about.name: Santiago
about.info_text: Santiago, the capital of Chile, is a dynamic and modern city nestled in a valley surrounded by the Andes Mountains. Known for its rich cultural heritage and stunning natural landscapes, Santiago offers a diverse range of experiences for visitors. From exploring historic neighborhoods to enjoying the vibrant arts scene, and savoring delicious Chilean cuisine, there's something for everyone in Santiago.
about.facts_text:
Population: Approximately 6.7 million
Region: Santiago Metropolitan Region
Time Zone: Chile Standard Time (CLT, UTC-3)
Language: Spanish
Currency: Chilean Peso (CLP)
about.climate_text: Santiago has a Mediterranean climate with hot, dry summers and cool, wet winters. The city enjoys plenty of sunshine, making it a great destination for outdoor activities.

attractions_card.title: La Moneda Palace
attractions_card.description: La Moneda Palace is the seat of the Chilean government and a historic landmark. Visitors can take guided tours and explore the beautiful surrounding gardens.

attractions_card.title: Santa Lucía Hill
attractions_card.description: Santa Lucía Hill is a small hill in the city center with walking trails, gardens, and panoramic views of Santiago. It's a great place for a leisurely hike.

attractions_card.title: Pablo Neruda's House
attractions_card.description: The former residence of Nobel laureate Pablo Neruda, known as La Chascona, is now a museum dedicated to the poet's life and work.

attractions_card.title: San Cristóbal Hill
attractions_card.description: San Cristóbal Hill is one of the city's largest green spaces and offers stunning views, a funicular railway, and the iconic Virgin Mary statue.

attractions_card.title: Museum of Pre-Columbian Art
attractions_card.description: This museum houses a vast collection of pre-Columbian artifacts, showcasing the art and culture of indigenous peoples from the Americas.

attractions_card.title: Central Market
attractions_card.description: The Central Market is a bustling place to enjoy Chilean seafood and local cuisine. It's a great spot to savor fresh fish and seafood dishes.

attractions_card.title: Santiago Metropolitan Cathedral
attractions_card.description: The Santiago Metropolitan Cathedral is a grand neo-Renaissance church with beautiful architecture and historical significance.

attractions_card.title: Bellavista Neighborhood
attractions_card.description: Bellavista is a bohemian neighborhood known for its vibrant nightlife, street art, and numerous restaurants and bars.

food_card.title: Empanadas
food_card.description: Empanadas are a popular Chilean snack, typically filled with ingredients like beef, cheese, or seafood, and baked to perfection.

food_card.title: Asado
food_card.description: Asado is the Chilean barbecue, featuring various cuts of meat, sausages, and vegetables grilled to smoky perfection.

food_card.title: Cazuela
food_card.description: Cazuela is a traditional Chilean soup made with meat, vegetables, and sometimes corn, offering a comforting and hearty meal.

food_card.title: Pastel de Choclo
food_card.description: Pastel de Choclo is a sweet and savory Chilean pie made with ground corn, meat, olives, and hard-boiled eggs.

food_card.title: Pisco Sour
food_card.description: Pisco Sour is a popular Chilean cocktail made with pisco (a grape brandy), lemon juice, sugar, and bitters, creating a tangy and refreshing drink.

hotels_card.title: The Ritz-Carlton Santiago
hotels_card.description: The Ritz-Carlton Santiago is a luxury hotel offering elegant rooms, a spa, and fine dining options, located in the El Golf district.

hotels_card.title: W Santiago
hotels_card.description: W Santiago is a stylish hotel in the Las Condes neighborhood, known for its modern design, rooftop bar, and lively atmosphere.

hotels_card.title: Hotel Singular Santiago
hotels_card.description: Hotel Singular Santiago offers a boutique experience in the historic Lastarria neighborhood, with unique rooms and a cozy ambiance.

hotels_card.title: Hyatt Centric Las Condes Santiago
hotels_card.description: Hyatt Centric offers contemporary accommodations in the Las Condes district, with a rooftop pool and bar to enjoy the city views.

hotels_card.title: Cumbres Lastarria Hotel
hotels_card.description: Cumbres Lastarria is a charming boutique hotel in the Lastarria neighborhood, known for its personalized service and comfortable rooms.

transport_card.title: Santiago Metro
transport_card.description: The Santiago Metro is a convenient way to navigate the city, with several lines connecting key areas, including the city center and suburbs.

transport_card.title: Public Buses
transport_card.description: Public buses are a common mode of transportation in Santiago, providing access to various neighborhoods and attractions.

transport_card.title: Taxis
transport_card.description: Taxis are readily available in Santiago and can be hailed on the street or booked through ride-sharing apps.

transport_card.alt: Comodoro Arturo Merino Benítez International Airport
transport_card.title: Comodoro Arturo Merino Benítez International Airport
transport_card.description: Santiago's main international airport, also known as Santiago Airport, connects the city with domestic and international destinations.
